news_header: An Israeli air strike on a tent camp in a Gaza hospital compound resulted in multiple casualties, including women and children, igniting widespread horror among witnesses.
news_text: Witnesses recounted a devastating Israeli air strike at the al-Aqsa Hospital compound in Deir al-Balah, Gaza, which ignited a fire in makeshift shelters for displaced people. At least four people were killed and dozens injured, primarily women and children. Eyewitnesses described scenes of chaos and despair, with people screaming and attempting to rescue others from the flames. The Israeli military claimed the strike targeted Hamas fighters, but humanitarian organizations, including Doctors Without Borders, disputed the presence of such a command center. The UN and White House expressed deep concern over the civilian casualties, emphasizing the need for Israel to minimize harm to non-combatants. The incident is part of an ongoing pattern of violence affecting the hospital, raising questions about safety for displaced residents in Gaza.
